title: How to Change Artboard Size in Adobe Illustrator

steps.title: Open your document in Illustrator.
steps.content: Open your document in Illustrator. Double-click the Illustrator project to open it. You'll need to have the project open in Illustrator in order to change the artboard size. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Find the artboard you want to resize.
steps.content: Find the artboard you want to resize. In the Artboards panel on the right side of the page, find the name of your artboard. If you don't see this panel, click the Window menu item at the top of the window (or screen if you're using a Mac), then click Artboards in the resulting drop-down menu.

steps.title: Double-click the "Artboard" icon.
steps.content: Double-click the "Artboard" icon. It's the box with a plus sign (+) to the right of the artboard's name. Doing so opens a pop-up window. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Change the artboard's width.
steps.content: Change the artboard's width. Adjust the number in the "Width" text box to do so. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Change the artboard's height.
steps.content: Change the artboard's height. Raise or lower the number in the "Height" text box to do so. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Click OK.
steps.content: Click OK . It's at the bottom of the window. This will save your changes and resize your artboard. If you need to change the position of art on your artboard, select the art in question, then click and drag the dotted line that appears.

steps.title: Open your document in Illustrator.
steps.content: Open your document in Illustrator. Double-click the Illustrator project to open it. You'll need to have the project open in Illustrator in order to change the artboard size. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Select artboards to resize.
steps.content: Select artboards to resize. In the "Artboards" panel on the right side of the page, you'll see a list of your artboards; hold down Ctrl (Windows) or ⌘ Command (Mac) while clicking each artboard you want to resize. If you don't see the Artboards panel, click the Window menu item at the top of the window (or screen if you're using a Mac), then click Artboards in the resulting drop-down menu.

steps.title: Press ⇧ Shift+O.
steps.content: Press ⇧ Shift + O . This will select your highlighted artboards and open their size values at the top of the Illustrator window. [6] X Research source

steps.title: Edit the artboards' sizes.
steps.content: Edit the artboards' sizes. You can type the size you want to use into the "W" (width) or "H" (height) text boxes at the top of the page to resize the artboards. If you need to change the position of art on each artboard, select the art in question, then click and drag the dotted line that appears.

steps.title: Open your document in Illustrator.
steps.content: Open your document in Illustrator. Double-click the Illustrator project to open it. You'll need to have the project open in Illustrator in order to change the artboard size. [7] X Research source

steps.title: Click Object.
steps.content: Click Object . It's a menu item that's either at the top of the Illustrator window (Windows) or at the top of the screen (Mac). Clicking it prompts a drop-down menu.

steps.title: Select Artboards.
steps.content: Select Artboards . This option is at the bottom of the drop-down menu. A pop-out menu will appear. [8] X Research source

steps.title: Click Fit to Artwork Bounds.
steps.content: Click Fit to Artwork Bounds . It's in the pop-out menu. Doing so will resize your artboard to fit its art. If you have multiple artboards, each artboard will be resized.
